channel.title: Is anyone on this forum fluent in Spanish?
channel.description:
Is anyone on this forum fluent in Spanish? Cause I need this stupid spanish journal which I wrote in spanish isn't completely correct, could you help... please lol? I used the magic word, I hope it works... I have a C in spanish right now and my dad is soooo pissed. The last test I studied for, I had a brain fart or something, and I totally messed up. If anyone could help for free that would be great. :) Here is my Spanish Journal Entry. Whenever I used / and then a vowel, that means that I was using an accent over that letter. Such as est/a would be esta with an accent over the a. :)
Mi vacacione de abril era muy aburrido. No habia el television, la computadora, o el estereo. Todos los d/ias, necesitamos cuidar a mi abuela. Porque ella era enferma...ugh. Pero fuimos a la cuidad de New York y esa era divertido. Fuimos a la madam Tausads y miramos Harrison Ford, Salma Hayek, Bill Clinton, y m/as. Sacamos muchos fotos. Entonces, fuimos al edifico de Empire State. ! Hacemos cola por cincuenta minutos! Hab/ia muchas personas y muchas chicas guapas :). La cuidad de New York era muy divertido. "It was only for one day, and I had 5 more days of boredom."
The quoted part isn't translated, I need help writing that sentence. Please don't use a translator, they all suck. Thanks a lot of you can help! ~Ron :)

item.title: Is anyone on this forum fluent in Spanish?
item.dc:creator: @IcyPimp IcyPimp
item.description:
@IcyPimp wrote:

O M F G:

Io thinko soo tooo, Spanisho iso soo annoyingo. I dispise it, as illegal imigrants(most speak Spanish) are taking over USA. I am not racist in any way,but there is a limit towards everything. The US latino population is about at 35% of the entire population of the country, if not more, and a large percent of that are illegal imigrants. I am not against anyone in specific or any race, but on my opinion this is clear: My family spent loads of time and money trying to get into US legaly and become fair citizens, while they just freakin jump over a wall. Where is the fairness???

35%? Dumbass.

I think you meant, your ePenis is 35% of the normal man’s ePenis.

item.title: Is anyone on this forum fluent in Spanish?
item.dc:creator: @reece8982 reece8982
item.description:
@reece8982 wrote:

Mi vacacione de abril era muy aburrido. No habia el television, la computadora, o el estereo. Todos los d/ias, necesitamos cuidar a mi abuela. Porque ella era enferma…ugh. Pero fuimos a la cuidad de New York y esa era divertido. Fuimos a la madam Tausads y miramos Harrison Ford, Salma Hayek, Bill Clinton, y m/as. Sacamos muchos fotos. Entonces, fuimos al edifico de Empire State. ! Hacemos cola por cincuenta minutos! Hab/ia muchas personas y muchas chicas guapas . La cuidad de New York era muy divertido. “It was only for one day, and I had 5 more days of boredom.”

well first ima ask you a few questions about spelling so i dun get any wrong. I’m not an expert but i know something.

Mi vacacione(vaccion?) de abril era muy aburrido. No habia el television, la computadora o(o) el estereo. thats all i question… tell me if there are even more errors cause i might mess-up.[br][size=1]Posted on: January 01, 2007, 11:25:30 AM[/size][hr]also, figure out the words that sound like english words. vaccion is vacsion prounounced in english. What do you think this means/is?

EDIT: my spanish teacher would love me for this hahaha.

item.title: Is anyone on this forum fluent in Spanish?
item.dc:creator: @curse63 curse63
item.description:
@curse63 wrote:

OOH I can help out.Im not fluent in spanish but.

Go to http://google.com/translate/ or something like that.
This will bring you to a translating page,click “English to Spanish”.

Now,when you are finished typing it in english,click OK and it appears in Spanish.Fluently.

If you dont know how to write what you wrote in English,no help there.
